content:
I noticed something really non-trivial today because I have countless ways of sitting in front of the computer.
Depending on where my eyes are in relation to the screen(s) they show less or more contrast. Practically speaking in certain angles I cannot see the blueish background of PMs anymore which means this fine but helpful distinction between stream and private is virtually gone.
It's probably also a question of IPS vs TN panel / cheap vs quality monitor but right now everyone with a budget monitor is at a disadvantage with the new blueish PM background. The yellow was better.
Suggestions: make it a user setting so that everyone can choose themselves.
Interesting. I suspect this is a monitor configuration issue; that blue should really have a pretty strong contrast.
I think we probably won't prioritize working on this unless we hear from other folks with a similar monitor issue, but I do appreciate the data point.

my phone had trouble to focus but when viewed from below the contrast is fine, from above it turns into white. On a laptop this is really a problem, but at work I notice it now as well. Some screens are particularly terrible. And no, it's not configuration related. This is a TN panel weakness. Terrible viewing angles.
VID_20170710_223507_1.mp4
FWIW, I also preferred the yellow, and AkaZulip got at least two other people commenting sadly on that change.

just checking again at work. Two of my three screens shift contract depending on viewing angle. The IPS panel doesn't as expected but the contrast isn't that strong on any of the three. For those who are using macs this is most likely a non-issue because they are using quality IPS panels.
interesting. Possibly this can be a part of our "high contrast mode" scheme.
Yeah, I think that's probably a good place to do this, since I bet anything else with lower contrast will also look bad on those screens :)

@Matthias Müller does this look better on your screen? :)
pasted image
yes, it does... the TN-Panel still shifts colour but it's a lot more eye catching and being close to sepia is generally a nice background for reading of the screen
glad to hear! it does seem to still shift a bit but making it stronger would impact the reading experience imo. this will be part of #5593 :)
Yellow PM background.mp4

that does look better! just to try, is hsl(53, 100%, 94%) too much when it comes to normal reading?
pasted image
yellow shifts into another colour but the blue shifts to white-ish so I prefer your change
cool. updated it to the stronger yellow :)

hm, I think it's a bit dangerous to change this much between high contrast mode and not, in that it'll be hard to maintain. This color appears in several places (missed message emails, digest email, emoji reactions), and has to play well with other decisions that are made (color for @-mention pills, color for code blocks, color for focus box (the blue rectangle).

Is there any sort of blue/gray that would not wash out? Or ideally e.g. the current color, with L (of HSL) bumped down a notch?
Yeah, I agree, this is going to be messy. E.g. I bet emoji reactions will look really wrong with that mode.
I would prefer to keep the colors similar from a maintainability perspective.
I agree that we should just pick a darker version of the blue. I maintain that screen wash out from bad viewing angles isn't a rabbit hole we should go down.

those are very good points-- @Matthias Müller, would something like this still work? it's just slightly darker.
pasted image

sorry, it still disappears. The only thing that seems to differ is the angle with which I have to look at it. It doesn't look like a true blue but a lot of grey as well.
It's totally fine on my IPS panel LCD, but both TN panels (1050p and 2160p) it changes. And on a big screen like this is even within the height of the screen. So if I was to stretch out Zulip from top to bottom, looking at home narrow and I have some PMs at the top and below stream msgs the top PM would almost appear like a stream msgs (apart from the missing colour).

I assume that many, many offices would only ever spend money on TN-panels. So this will be an issue but people will realise, it's their screens and so not give feedback here. Could you not add a dedicated TN-panel setting that turns the PM background yellow?
i'd be up for working on a separate feature as it's a very similar workflow to the high_contrast_mode feature i'm working on right now-- what do others think?
look at it like a kind of Braille for offices with budget equipment
besides... if you have made the blue/grey background darker it's not really in the spirit of high_contrast_mode, is it?
indeed, making it any darker would cause problems in terms of the text contrast
We could add a dotted background or some other non-color-based marker in high contrast mode.
i'm wondering if a dotted background would make the text less readable-- and if we still use the blue as background/foreground for the dots, it will still be unreadable under certain angles.

Alternatively the font colour could be different (dark red or dark blue) for PMs. But that might jar even more. But I'm not in favour of dotted background either. It feels Windows 95/ 8bit colour depth ish.
